title: Requires the commissioner of motor vehicles to conduct a study of the economic impact of ATV use within the state
summary: Requires the commissioner of motor vehicles to conduct a study of the economic impact of ATV use within the state.

       Introduced  by M. of A. CROUCH, BARCLAY, DUPREY -- Multi-Sponsored by --
         M. of A. AMEDORE, CONTE, FINCH, GIGLIO, HAWLEY, HAYES, KOLB, MOLINARO,

       AN ACT requiring the commissioner of the department of motor vehicles to
         conduct a study on the economic impact of all terrain vehicle usage in
         this state

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Report on economic impact of ATV use. 1.  The  commissioner
    2  of motor vehicles shall, in conjunction with the commissioner of econom-
    3  ic  development  and  the commissioner of parks, recreation and historic
    4  preservation, prepare a summary report on the economic impact of ATV use
    5  and recreation in New York state. Such report shall include, but not  be
    6  limited to, the following:
    7    a.  the  number  of  ATV  participants  in New York state, including a
    8  breakdown of resident and non-resident ATV participants;
    9    b. the frequency of participation of ATV owners and  drivers  and  how
   10  much  money  they spend on their activities including but not limited to
   11  expenditures on equipment, hotels and motels, restaurants,  lodges,  and
   12  camps, grocery and hardware stores, and guide services; and
   13    c. an estimate of the number of jobs that are supported by ATV partic-
   14  ipants  as  well  as the amount of sales tax and income tax generated by
   15  such participants.
   16    2. The results of the report required by this section shall be submit-
   17  ted to the governor and to the legislature, including the chairs of  the
   18  assembly ways and means committee, environmental conservation committee,
   19  tourism,  arts and sports development committee, and the economic devel-
   20  opment committee, as well as the chairs of the senate finance committee,
   21  environmental conservation committee,  tourism,  recreation  and  sports
   22  development  committee,  and  commerce,  economic  development and small
